item.title: Disgusting overgrowth 14-16 sandy hill avenue, 3rd August
item.description:
Lots of overgrowth behind sandy hill ave that has been going on for a number of years. This overgrowth is now causing lots and lots of rats to enter gardens that back onto this. There are children who live in these houses. It needs to be sorted
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandy Hill Avenue, London

item.title: The Turkish bald head shopkeeper, owner of this chats organic shop at 2 Chatsworth Rd, London E5 0LP abused and beat up a mental health, drug user, person who was shoplifting in his shop. The video of the boss man beating this poor shoplifter up taking the law into his own hands instead of calling local authority or police. Shop owner was slapping and punching the shoplifter who was crying and pleading for shop owner to stop hurting him.The metropolitan police need to take action on shopkeeper video evidence online.This video has been uploaded online at: https://youtube.com/shorts/QL0RxJVgAVA?si=J5rH0RSsM-GeVbKf of the shopkeeper beating up a shoplifter and people are finding it funny this is unlawful and illegal abuse. If this could please be investigated. No one's above the law., 3rd August
item.description:
Antisocial behaviour shopkeeper abusing the law and beating up a shop lifter with mental health drug addictions. Needs to be investigated.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chatsworth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised paving slabs are trip hazard, 3rd August
item.description:
This pavement is off of the public pavement area but needs repair as it presents a trip hazard to the public, who may be accessing the Samaritan's Project or Maple Care Home. Some of the slabs have lifted 5cm. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glynde Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes next to speedbumps, 3rd August
item.description:
Potholes have opened up next to speed bumps in Upton Road, as it comes down from Townley/Arbuthnot, towards the Broadway. The speed bumps have potholes opening up where the cars come down the hill and go over the bump, hitting the road and creating potholes. The worst being on the hill going down towards the Iris/Lion junction and Fairway area. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upton Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins are getting out of hand. AGAIN, 3rd August
item.description:
The bin men never bother with our flats anymore. Filthy bins overflowing and attracting Flies,Foxes and Even Rats now. It’s getting to the point where the smell is strong. You can smell it whilst close by. You guys say it’ll be sorted but we’re here again.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cazenove Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
